solution_line_template: Meryll has written {total_mc_questions} questions x {mc_written_fraction} = <<{total_mc_questions}*{mc_written_fraction}={mc_written}>>{mc_written} multiple-choice questions.
While she has written {total_ps_questions} questions x {ps_written_fraction} = <<{total_ps_questions}*{ps_written_fraction}={ps_written}>>{ps_written} problem-solving questions.

The total number of questions that Meryll has to write is {total_mc_questions} questions + {total_ps_questions} questions = <<{total_mc_questions}+{total_ps_questions}={total_questions_to_write}>>{total_questions_to_write} questions.
Meryll has written a total of {mc_written} questions + {ps_written} questions = <<{mc_written}+{ps_written}={total_questions_written}>>{total_questions_written} questions.

Hence, she needs to write {total_questions_to_write} questions - {total_questions_written} questions = <<{total_questions_to_write}-{total_questions_written}={questions_needed_more}>>{questions_needed_more} questions more.
